thread.title: Chrissy Teigen pregnant; 'Daredevil' trailer; Will Ferrell-themed bar: AM Buzz
thread.title_full: Chrissy Teigen pregnant; 'Daredevil' trailer; Will Ferrell-themed bar: AM Buzz

author: Geoff Herbert | gherbert@syracuse.com
title: Chrissy Teigen pregnant; 'Daredevil' trailer; Will Ferrell-themed bar: AM Buzz
text:
Comments 
Sports Illustrated swimsuit model and social media star Chrissy Teigen is pregnant and expecting her first child with husband John Legend. The 29-year-old beauty said the couple had been struggling to conceive but announced the happy baby news late Monday . "As many of you know, we've been trying to have a baby for a while now," she said. "It hasn't been easy, but we kept trying because we can't wait to bring our first child into the world and grow our family. We're so excited that it's finally happening." » Read more at the Daily Mail . 
Marvel's "Jessica Jones" hasn't even begun streaming on Netflix yet, but the first trailer for "Daredevil" season 2 has leaked online. Footage debuted at New York Comic Con over the weekend, and now everyone can see the last 30 seconds of new scenes with the blind ninja lawyer Matt Murdock (Charlie Cox), nurse Claire (Rosario Dawson) and glimpses of newcomers Elektra (Elodie Yung) and Frank Castle's Punisher ("The Walking Dead" star Jon Bernthal). The new season debuts next year. Season 1 was awesome.Watch the @Daredevil #NYCC sizzle... Season 2 looks epic! http://t.co/Ce7EJjhZkT https://t.co/Ak03ebZIJq — App Store (@AppStore) October 12, 2015 
A Will Ferrell-themed bar is now open in New York City, called Stay Classy New York. The joint at 174 Rivington Street features drinks like "Milk was a Bad Choice," "You're My Boy Blue" and "Mugatu Mule," but it's currently only in previews to exclusive customers. No word on whether the "SNL" star is involved, but you can bet trivia nights will be more fun than singing at the North Pole (we do it all the time). » Read more at E! News . 
Oof: Charlie Sheen got headlocked at a California bar on Saturday night and thrown out by bouncers. Video shows the 50-year-old actor at Hennessey's Tavern in Dana Point, where he reportedly got upset a woman was filming him on her phone and didn't stop when he asked. Luckily, he smoothed things over after being escorted out and even took a photo with security, so he's apparently still winning. » Read more at Entertainment Tonight . 
And a "Big Lebowski" mashup video shows Donald Trump being told to shut up by John Goodman's Walter Sobchak character. "They're bringing drugs," the 2016 presidential candidate says in a clip. "Shut the f--- up, Donny." Highlights include Trump's clash with Syracuse native Megyn Kelly, his favorite Bible verse and how he likes "people who weren't captured." Dude. Note: Video contains explicit language.

AM Buzz is a weekday morning feature on syracuse.com where we'll post the latest in viral videos, trending topics, celebrity gossip and entertainment news.
